sect1.title: What is and what is for?
sect1.simpara: PHPGrid is a PHP object that allows to browse/add/edit/search/delete records in a database table. After search internet for a similar product, we decided to create a new one starting from scratch, because existing ones don't have the required functionality, for example, create master-detail forms, manage calculated fields, etc.

sect1.title: Goals
sect1.para: The main goal is speed up the development of database web applications inside Security Data, allowing reuse code and isolating common processes in database applications. We have decided to publish it as OpenSource to allow others to contribute.

sect1.title: Database interface
sect1.para: To access databases, we use ADOdb, which allows transparent access to any database. This component is only tested with MySQL, it's encouraged to know how ADOdb works to get the max of this component, for example, calculated fields, but don't worry, it's very easy.

sect2.title: Properties
sect2.para: In the doc directory you can find a complete reference of properties and methods, is generated using PHPDocumentor, in this section we are going to see how to use some of them.

sect3.title: Labels
sect3.para: This array holds the labels will be used to show the fields to the user instead the field names, the array must be in the form field=label

sect3.title: Relations
sect3.para: This array holds the relationships with another tables, the array must be in the form field=properties, where properties is another array in the format property=value

listitem.para: detailtable: Table which contain detail records
linkfield: Field to link, the relationship can be 1-1 or 1-n
displayfield: Field to display on the grid, useful to a relationship 1-1
displayfunction: Function to call to get the field value instead of the real field, useful to formatting purposes
$rs is an ADOdb result set which contains all the records of the detail table filtered by the linkfield. This is useful to format the field contents or to show a composed field.
refpage: This is a link to another page to manage the detail table, useful for 1-n relationships

sect3.title: Controls
sect3.para: This array specifies which controls will be used to edit the information of each field, the array must be in the form of field=value, where control is another array in which the first element is the kind of control, and the value of that element is another array with the properties in format property=value.

listitem.para: edit: Input field, you can set any parameters valid for an <input> tag, except type, name and value
textarea: Textbox, you can set any parameters valid for an <input> tag, except name
radio: No parameters
checkbox: No parameters
combo: You can set which items to show using the items property, an array of value=text
list: The same as combo, but it shows a list
custom: This kind of control is useful to create custom controls, the only parameter you must setup is the function will be called to get the control. This function must be this way:
$field is a fieldobject of the field to edit, and $value, the value the control must show. The returning control must have the name of the field, because is used to updates and lookups.

sect3.title: calculatedfields
sect3.para: This array is useful to add fields ta table, for example, with custo operations to perform on each record or with additional information from another sources, the array format is fieldlabel=functiontocall
The function prototype must be in this way, $rs is a resultset positioned on the adequate field.

sect3.title: getfieldvaluefunctions
sect3.para: This array is used to format a field using a function, both in the grid and in the form. The array must be in the form field=function.
$field is a fieldobject and $value the current value
